title: Perception Task can only spawn one object at a time

content.raw:
Our documentation for the perception task leaves open the possibility that multiple objects might be displayed at the same time. However, our implementation makes this impossible because:

* objects are stored in a queue such that only one object is associated with each trial, and
* changes in trials only occur when the current time becomes greater than or equal to the time associated with the first object in the queue.

Options:

* We could leave as is and support only one object per trial.
* We could add support for multiple objects per trial.

    * If we do this, I think the best solution is to define a <trial> object that takes a set of objects all associated with a single <time> element, then remove the <time> element from the individual <object> elements.
    * We will also need to implement some method for submitting a solution that identifies multiple objects.
